intro: Semarillaria obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate semarillaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink to purple. The plant is native to tropical regions of South America and thrives in humid, warm climates. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as undergrowth in rainforests. The flowers attract pollinators like bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
